hide.markdownDescription:
Hide the current level of completion items
 - Sub-items will not be hidden unless they also set the `hide` property
 - Mainly used to cooperate with hooks to dynamically add completion items, as dynamic addition may cause duplication, so it is necessary to hide the original completion items

tip.markdownDescription:
Completion item tip
- General structure of the completion tip: `Usage` + `Description` + `Example`
- Here is an example:
```json
  "tip": [
    "U: -r, --revisions <REVSETS>\n",
    "xxx (Here is the description)\n",
    "E: -r '@-'   --- xxx (Example description)\n"
    "   -r 'x-'   --- xxx (Example description)"
  ]
  ```

next.markdownDescription:
Next command completion
- It can be an array or the number `0`
- If it is an array
  - Items in the array are automatically added to the completions.
  - If there are `hooks`, they will be added dynamically.
- If it is the number `0`
  - It indicates that a content should be input at this time.
  - However, [PSCompletions](https://pscompletions.abgox.com) is unable to provide completions, and users need to input manually.
  - `0` tells [PSCompletions](https://pscompletions.abgox.com) that it should display symbols of the `WriteSpaceTab` type to achieve symbol prediction.

then.errorMessage: It must be an array or the number 0

options.markdownDescription:
Optional completion for the root command
- If there is only one root command other than optional completions, they will be displayed
- Unless you have used it or its alias

common_options.markdownDescription:
Common optional completion
- Any time you trigger completion, they will be displayed
- Unless you have used it or its alias

info.markdownDescription:
Additional information
- They can be accessed in the `tip` field of this json file using `{{ $info.xxx }}`

config.description: Special configuration items for the completion command

name.description: Name of the special configuration item

value.description: Default value of the special configuration item

values.markdownDescription:
Optional values of the special configuration item
- Here, you can fill in the values that will be displayed when the command completion is triggered
 - Suppose the command completion is `xxx` and the configuration item name is `enable_xxx`
 - Then, when you input `psc completion xxx enable_xxx` and trigger completion, the values in the `values` array will be displayed in the completion list
